Issues.Title: TreeView images not scaled on high DPI
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 6.0.9

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

When a monitor is scaled, for example 150%, tree view images are still small while labels are scaled well. See also https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6380

I know the issue is solved in .NET 7 preview, but will this be backported to .NET 6 since version 6 is a LTS version which we plan to use for some time?

### Steps to reproduce

See https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6380
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "TreeView images not scaled on high DPI" (#7868)

Issues.Title: Port fix for IDataObject.GetData with non-serializable type returns null
Issues.Body:
Port #7869 and #7876 

<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7864


## Proposed changes

Revert ComWrapper usage to allow managed types to cycle through drag and drop.

## Customer Impact

Without this change, drag and drop does not work in many (most?) customer applications.

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Low.

Issues.Title: Hiding a ToolStripMenuItem on DropDownClosed throws exception if closed by hovering over different menu item
Issues.Body:
### .NET version Version: 6.0.300 Commit: 8473146e7d Also did not work in .NET Framework 4.8 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? No, it did not work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+. ### Issue description
Exception stack trace 
System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException: Index was out of range. Must be non-negative and less than the size of the collection. (Parameter 'index')
   at System.Collections.ArrayList.get_Item(Int32 index)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection.get_Item(Int32 index)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ClearAllSelectionsExcept(ToolStripItem item)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.NotifySelectionChange(ToolStripItem item)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Select()
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.HandleMouseEnter(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.OnMouseMove(MouseEventArgs mea)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ScrollableControl.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlNativeWindow.WndProc(Message& m)
   at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, WM msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)
Screen recording of the issue https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23175424/193817496-069210c5-edd2-4014-903f-e68a3e9e67d1.mp4
[Test VS solution to reproduce (includes .NET 6 and .NET Framework 4.8 projects)](https://github.com/jonaskohl/MenuStripBug) --- Problem is probably caused by a race condition in [`ToolStrip.ClearAllSelectionsExcept(ToolStripItem)`](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ToolStrip.cs#L1951-L2020). ### Steps to reproduce 1. Have a `MenuStrip` with at least one visible and one hidden `ToolStripMenuItem`. Have an event listener for `DropDownClosed` on the hidden item which sets that item's `Visible` property to `false`. 2. Programatically trigger the hidden menu item by first setting `menuItem.Visible = true` and then calling `menuItem.ShowDropDown()`. 3. Hover over another menu item, thus closing the (intially) hidden item's dropdown. 4. A `System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException` will be thrown.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hiding a ToolStripMenuItem on DropDownClosed throws exception if closed by hovering over different menu item" (#7884)

Issues.Title: Enable `CA1852`/`CA1812` Analyzers
Issues.Body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

- `CA1852` Analyzer for sealing non-public classes which are not inherited from for performance reasons https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/performance_improvements_in_net_7/#analyzers
- `CA1812` Avoid uninstantiated internal classes for performance https://learn.microsoft.com/en-au/dotnet/fundamentals/code-analysis/quality-rules/ca1812

The configs are stored here: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/eng/CodeAnalysis.src.globalconfig.

### Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

N/A

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enable `CA1852`/`CA1812` Analyzers" (#7879)

Issues.Title: Consider adding drag and drop UI tests that drop serialized and non-serialized objects
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 7.0 RC1

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Issue description

As a result of #7864, we could use some drag and drop tests which drop serialized and non-serialized data to the application, to catch any regressions that might arise from work being done in this area. I've written 2 tests covering both the serialized and non-serialized scenarios, with the serialized case working as expected, and the non-serialized case failing, as reported by the customer. Initial results show that the fix in #7869 alleviates the issue described in #7864. I can submit a PR with the tests.

### Steps to reproduce

Drag and drop non-serialized custom type

1. Create a `DataObject` instance.
2. Create an instance of a custom non-serialized object.
3. On `MouseDown`, call `DataObject.SetData` to store the non-serialized object in the data object.
4. On `MouseDown`, call `Control.DoDragDrop`.
5. On `DragOver`, call `DataObject.GetData` to retrieve the non-serialized object from the data object.
6. Verify that the object retrieved from `DataObject.GetData` is not `null`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Consider adding drag and drop UI tests that drop serialized and non-serialized objects" (#7875)

Issues.Title: Add serialized and non-serialized object drag and drop UI tests
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7875 

## Proposed changes

- Add UI tests which drag and drop serialized and non-serialized data to the application.
- I've written 2 tests covering both the serialized and non-serialized scenarios, with the serialized case working as expected, and the non-serialized case failing, as reported by the customer.
- Initial results show that the fix in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7869 alleviates the issue described in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/7864.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Supports the work being done in #5163 
- Regression test for #7864 

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Ran unit and integration tests.

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET 7 RC1

<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: IDataObject.GetData with non-serializable type returns null
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 7 RC1

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, up to and including .NET 6.

### Issue description

Hello,

My name is Norton, and I'm writing on behalf of the WinForms team at DevExpress.

Our customers who were testing our controls with the .NET 7 RC1 runtime reported issues when using our controls' drag-drop capabilities. Upon further research, we found what seems to be a breaking change in .NET 7: whenever an instance of a non-serializable class is used with the [`Control.DoDragDrop`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.control.dodragdrop) method, calling [`IDataObject.GetData`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.idataobject.getdata) with that class as a parameter afterwards returns `null` rather than the dragged object.

We could not find any issues/PRs or MSDN articles documenting this change. Could you have a look and let us know if this change is intended?

### Steps to reproduce

I attached a sample application. To replicate this behavior, run the project and start dragging anywhere on the form. The [`Debugger.Break`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.diagnostics.debugger.break) method is called to indicate that the `GetData` method returned `null`.

If the type of the dragged object is made serializable (e.g. by modifying the `using` statement in `Form1.cs`), this behavior no longer takes place.

[DXApplication1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9674453/DXApplication1.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "IDataObject.GetData with non-serializable type returns null" (#7864)

Issues.Title: Convert ComCtl32 ImageList Methods to Cswin32
Issues.Body:
- Convert ImageList methods: `Add`,`Create`,`Destroy`,`Draw`,`DrawEx`,`Duplicate`,`GetIconSize`,`GetImageCount`,`GetImageInfo`,`Remove`,`Replace`,
`ReplaceIcon`,`SetBkColor`
- Removed enum/struct: `ILC`,`IMAGEINFO`

Note:
`ILD` enum has not been removed due to [missing enum values in metadata](https://github.com/microsoft/win32metadata/issues/1285) 
ImageList `Read`/`Write`/`WriteEx` method conversion postponed until COM work done on cswin32 side

Issues.Title: Fix IndexOutOfRangeException When Opening FileDialog with Filters
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7850

Expected input for FileDialog filter is in format : "filterName1|filterSpec1|filterName2|filterSpec2|filterName3|filterSpec3....etc". When processing the filter, we split it with separator "|" into an array and we were mismatching filter name/spec pairs, e.g. we were grabbing filterSpec2 and filterName3, leading to IndexOutOfRangeException once getting to the end of the array.

## Regression? 

- Yes, regressed in [#7674](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7674)

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
Received IndexOutOfRangeException whenever 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30007367/192901368-31f0ac69-f5bc-4cc8-9608-33d19dc7bbc8.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30007367/192901407-b58994ca-894c-4a37-86c8-7a877a9955a0.png)


### After
FileDialog opens as expected
![fix](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30007367/192901504-39a88cc5-3ea1-49cd-a7ee-787fe7acb261.gif)


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7860)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix IndexOutOfRangeException When Opening FileDialog with Filters" (#7860)

Issues.Title: In a special case of winform, the exception prompt cannot be thrown, and the program will automatically exit in about 4 seconds
Issues.Body:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/winform在一个特殊情况下，异常提示无法抛出，并且程序在4秒左右会自动退出/10156622)._

---
\[severity:It’s more difficult to complete my work\]  
[20220924\_201014.mp4](https://aka.ms/dc/file?name=B1b12694a77f84006b1f351665f11271f637996184524298897_20220924_201014.mp4&tid=1b12694a77f84006b1f351665f11271f637996184524298897)

Translated by Bing: 1. Created a WinForm program
2. Create a new user control, add a button to the control (and add it to the main window when WinForm starts)
3. The function of the button is to start a thread
4. The thread method is to actively throw an error

When debugging in visual studio, it is normal for exceptions to be thrown.
But when we run the exe program directly, after about 4 seconds, the program exits directly without any abnormal prompt!

---

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "In a special case of winform, the exception prompt cannot be thrown, and the program will automatically exit in about 4 seconds" (#7858)

Issues.Title: Remove Last Gdi32 Structs/Enums to Use Cswin32
Issues.Body:
- Remove structs: `BITMAP`,`BITMAPINFOHEADER`,`LOGBRUSH`,`LOGPALETTE`,`LOGPEN`,`RGNHEADER`,`TEXTMETRICW`,`RGBQUAD`
- Remove enums: `BI`,`BS`,`EMR`,`ICM`,`MWT`,`OUT_PRECIS`,`PS`,`QUALITY`,`RGN`,`TMPF`,`StockObject`
- Move enum `FW` to Gdi folder
